structure.unit: PUBLIC LAWS IN FORCE -- COURT RULES

law.catch_line: Laws not to limit right of Court of Justice to promulgate rules.
law.text: No act creating, repealing, or modifying any statute shall be construed directly, or by implication, to limit the right of the Court of Justice to promulgate rules from time to time or to supersede, modify, or amend any rule so promulgated. Nor shall any statute be construed to limit in any manner the power of the Court of Justice to make rules governing practice and procedure in the courts.
law.history: Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 62, sec. 127, effective June 19, 1976. -- Amended 1966 Ky. Acts ch. 255, sec. 279, effective June 16, 1966. --Created 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 18, sec. 4, effective February 25, 1952.
